name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
takeaway: DRC's vast mineral wealth is at the center of China's engagement in DRC.
Human rights issues emerge in DRC-China relations only when it pertains to mining activities where there are complaints about how Chinese management is treating local employees.
China's media activities in DRC are mostly geared towards promoting a positive image of China and DRC-China relations
description-1: In 2023, Democratic Republic of the Congo had a GDP per capita of US$649 and a total population of 104.06 million people.
description-2: Democratic Republic of the Congo established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1972. Democratic Republic of the Congo was ranked 123rd in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 19/100.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
Link can't be provided but information is provided based on hands on experience. A provincial governor can sign an agreement with a subsidiary of  PRC or SOE itself for building small infrastructures. They're not major infrastructures. That's why it's marked yes, but insignficant.
Since no link can be provided, the indicator has been skipped.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In 2013 an agreement was supposed to be signed between the capital city kinshasa and city of Jiangxi. But the agreement was never signed.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Based on my experience as a researcher,  and knowledge with different stakeholders, I can confirm that many DRC officials have travelled to China with all expenses paid by chinese SOE. These trips are all of the economic nature. But since it's not public knowledge, we can't have links to back the information. But since the lack of evidence of PRC entities or connected individuals claiming that they have paid for these officials trip, the indicator will be changed to skip.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: DRC officials have history of visiting China and meeting with either their chinese counterparts or representatives of PRC SOE. The latest high profile visit was in may with DRC president Felix Tshisekedi visiting China
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Based on experience, research and access to certain political circles and chinese companies, I do know that some of them have financed electoral campaign for some DRC politicians. Since these are not official activities and there won’t be any supporting evidence to the claim, I have put Skip as answer.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In an investigative report called "Congo Hold-up" published by a consortium of international journalists, it was established that a company linked to former president Joseph Kabila and his family had been receiving funds derived from a mining deal signed in 2008 between the DRC and PRC companies. The information is from 2021.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Domestic Politics.evidence: As I said earlier, China is not really a topic of  discussion, so people don't talk about China. Even when it comes to criticising china's investment in mining in DRC, NGO and medias are rather free to do so.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.
